intro: Medinilla schumanniana, commonly known as the velvet tangerine or velvet tangerine plant, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to white, often with a yellow center. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers. Medinilla schumanniana is also valued for its ability to bloom year-round under proper care.
